getInstance

public static LogicalVariable getInstance(java.lang.String name,
                                          java.lang.String prefix,
                                          int size)
Returns a StdLogicalVariable with the specified name. Its population will have the specified size, and each individual is a Constant whose name is given by prefix + index. Index starts on 1.

Parameters:
name - THe name of the variable
prefix - Prefix of each individual in the population
size - The size of the population
Returns:
a StdLogicalVariable with the specified name and population size

individualsSatisfying

public Population individualsSatisfying(java.util.Set<Constraint> constraints)
Description copied from interface: LogicalVariable
Returns all individuals of the population of this logical variable that satisfy the specified set of constraints of the form X != t. (t must be a constant).

Note that, if t is a logical variable, then there is no way of finding out which value to constrain in the population. Binary constraints are silently ignored during account.

This method does not check whether the constraints are consistent, that is, if the second term is a constant representing an individual from this logical variable population.

Specified by:
individualsSatisfying in interface LogicalVariable
Parameters:
constraints - A set of constraints that restricts the individuals of the population from this logical variable
Returns:
A set containing all individuals satisfying the specified set of constraints.
